Gets folder sizes using COM and with a fallback to robocopy.exe with the logging option

Gets folder sizes using COM and with a fallback to robocopy.exe with the logging option , which makes it not actually copy or move files, but just list them, and the end summary result is parsed to extract the relevant data.
This apparently is much faster than .NET and Get-ChildItem in PowerShell.

The properties of the objects will be different based on which method is used, but the "TotalBytes" property is always populated if the directory size was successfully retrieved. Otherwise you should get a warning.
Copyright (C) 2015, Joakim Svendsen All rights reserved. Svendsen Tech.
Path or paths to measure size of.
Number of digits after decimal point in rounded numbers.
Do not use COM, only robocopy, for always getting full details.
Path or paths to measure size of.
Number of digits after decimal point in rounded numbers.

Fixes Profilelist in the registry. To fix user logon with temp profile.
Connects to a server, Compare Profilelist in registry to what is on disk, and deletes registry if needed. The next time a user logs on, new profile will be created, and not a temp profile.
Removes ghost devices from your system
Removes ghost devices from your system

This parameter will exclude devices that match the class name provided. This parameter needs to be specified in an array format for all the class names you want to be excluded from removal. This is an exact string match so "Disk" will not match "DiskDrive".

This parameter will exclude devices that match the partial name provided. This parameter needs to be specified in an array format for all the friendly names you want to be excluded from removal. "Intel" will match "Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E5-2680 0 @ 2.70GHz". "Loop" will match "Microsoft Loopback Adapter".
listDevicesOnly will output a table of all devices found in this system.
listGhostDevicesOnly will output a table of all 'ghost' devices found in this system.

This parameter will exclude devices that match the class name provided. This parameter needs to be specified in an array format for all the class names you want to be excluded from removal. This is an exact string match so "Disk" will not match "DiskDrive".

This parameter will exclude devices that match the partial name provided. This parameter needs to be specified in an array format for all the friendly names you want to be excluded from removal. "Intel" will match "Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E5-2680 0 @ 2.70GHz". "Loop" will match "Microsoft Loopback Adapter".
listDevicesOnly will output a table of all devices found in this system.
listGhostDevicesOnly will output a table of all 'ghost' devices found in this system.

maml:alert.maml:para: Permission level has not been tested. It is assumed you will need to have sufficient rights to uninstall devices from device manager for this script to run properly.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Remove all ghost devices EXCEPT any devices that have "Intel" or "Citrix" in their friendly name

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 6 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Remove all ghost devices EXCEPT any devices that are apart of the classes "LegacyDriver" or "Processor"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 7 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Remove all ghost devices EXCEPT for devices with a friendly name of "Intel" or "Citrix" or with a class of "LegacyDriver" or "Processor"
